cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi SSE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to move slowly NNW today, then turn W-NW across or just north of the Yucatan Peninsula Monday, enter the central Gulf Tuesday and accelerate northwestward toward the north-central Gulf Coast (southeast LA-MS coast) by late Wednesday.

weather_observation.watch_coast: N/A – current watches confined to western Cuba and northern Yucatan Peninsula
weather_observation.warning_coast: N/A – current warnings confined to Pinar del Río, Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern and eastern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward to Alabama/Florida Panhandle most directly in the cone; outer hazards could extend west to the upper Texas coast.
weather_observation.wind: Low (6%) chance of experiencing sustained tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions possible Wednesday–Thursday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor water level rises of 1–2 ft possible on the upper Texas coast if onshore flow develops, but significant surge (>3 ft) is not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands on the western flank of Zeta could drop 1–3 inches of rain over southeast Texas late Wednesday into Thursday; widespread 4-inch totals are not expected.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated thunderstorms and brief squalls could create short-duration visibility reductions affecting vessel movements.
